physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Breasts were symmetric with no skin changes, nipple discharge, or erosions. A flat, mobile mass measuring 5.0 cm by 5.0 cm was palpated in the upper outer quadrant of the left breast. No lymphadenopathy, and no mass in the right breast; remainder of the examination was normal.
The breast mass had not decreased in size.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: No change in the bone lesion; it remained stable or smaller.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Enlarging axillary nodes grew rapidly from approximately 2 cm to 5 cm, causing discomfort.
A new cancer was found in the opposite breast; surgical margins were clear.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The previous bone lesion remained stable, and there were no new metastases.
